awd_titl_txt: Hydrowinch and Automated Probe Sampling System for an       Undergraduate Ocean Studies Laboratory Aboard a Six Campus  Consortium Vessel
awd_abstract_narration: A multi-channeled, electromagnetic cable winch with automated multi-            parameter probe sensors will be used by undergraduate students from six         southern California state universities aboard the Southern California           Ocean Studies Consortium teaching vessel. With this winch and                   instrumentation the laboratory exercises will expose students to the            application of current principles and analytical techniques.  The               equipment makes possible a continuity in the laboratory exercises by            eliminating the need to return to the home campus for data analyses.            This provides the students with a much needed "hands on" experience with        automated instrumentation.  This type of experience with this equipment         in the "at sea" laboratory enhances the preparation of prospective              graduates for future professional work.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY LONG BEACH RESEARCH FOUNDATION
